Description: Lamp and stand; bronze; the stand has a baluster stem with expanding tripod base, and thick disc with grooved edge below the spike; the lamp has a long neck and low foot pierced with a square hole for the spike; the handle consists of two spirals united at the top by an ornamental finial, the ends below terminating in discs; from the central disc rises a cross patée; the circular hole for filling is covered by a conical lid with double hinge.
